column1: Royal HaskoningDHV is an independent consultancy which integrates 140 years of engineering expertise with digital technologies and software solutions. As consulting engineers

column1: What You Will Do As Site Planner/Expeditor
Report to Head of Construction as line manager;
Report to Construction Manager on project level;
Maintain and regular update on the construction schedule and inform to CM;
Collect the schedule from all contractors and combine into master schedule;
Manage and track the master schedule into the detailed level that can be tracked;
Ensure the resources deployment included in the schedule;
Advise the actual resource productivity of Contractor based on performed and actual schedule to the Construction Manager;
Prepare daily monitoring and three week a head monitoring schedule for Discipline Supervisor and Site Engineer;
Report and investigate any deviation in the master schedule compare to the Client project milestone and assist CM to prepare mitigation plan;
Advise CM for any schedule deviation or foreseen deviation in the future;
Verify actual works progress at the site and advise CM on the deviation;
Prepare draft of monthly report for CM regarding schedule and progress.
You will be based in Kota Damansara

JOB PURPOSE

  • Facilitate HRBP functions and programs within the HRBP department.
  • Support HRBP in managing the Human Resources operation function for Operations and Support Unit Group to achieve operational excellence throughout the employee life cycle and contribute to the positioning of the company as a leading marine and heavy engineering organization of choice.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support HRBP through assistance in solving the human resources related issues where proactive communications is an essence to develop integrated solutions between HR Central and business management.
  • Assist in facilitating the BU manpower budget/planning process
column2:
to identify current and future manpower requirements to support the BU in achieving its current and long short- and long-term business/operational objectives.
  • Follow-up with Talent Sourcing Unit on the placement
column3:
sourcing and/ or recruitment status and update BU heads.
  • Gather inputs from HRBP related to BU perspective in the development of HR strategies and policies to ensure that they are aligned to the business needs and requirements.
  • Prepare and coordinate the report for HRBP in managing the of Business Unit organizational performance through individual
column5:
and organizational development.
  • Support HRBP in facilitating the assessment of training effectiveness between staff and superior to gauge the impact towards staff performance and addressing the identified competency gaps.
  • Responsible to manage and sort all enquiries and escalation to be channelled to the respective HRBP in charge.
  • Act as a front desk Administrator for HRBP department
  • Prepare and consolidate reports related to recruitment activities and manpower for HRBP department
  • Manage manpower documentation in pre and post hiring activities before submission to Talent Acquisition department
  • Act as the Focal Point within HRBP department vs HR Division internally related to staff engagement particularly on updating the HRBP team on HR policy communication and implementation
column7:
responding to queries and complaints to ensure a harmonious working environment.
  • Co-facilitate HRM initiatives together with HRBP.

column1:
REQUIREMENTS

  • Degree in Human Resource Management / Business Administration or equivalent.
  • 2 – 4 years working experience (minimum 2 years in Human Resource Management)

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve
column2: grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.
our Power Solutions team is geared towards providing a more integrated approach offering end-to-end service to support our clients in energy networks
column3: thermal generation
column4: renewable generation and storage solutions space. We are helping our clients meet the challenges faced in countries and cities across the globe
column5: providing innovative solutions from replacing conventional thermal power plants with renewable energy to developing demand side management strategies.

column1: We are seeking a Commissioning Manager. The purpose of this role is to provide high standards of HSE
column2: site supervision and quality execution of commissioning activities leading up to commercial operation of the plant. Provide leadership to project site team (in absence of the project manager) to help ensure all commissioning activities and tasks are carried out to meet the project requirements. Provide leadership to ensure that all commissioning works will be executed as per the work method statements
column3: and installations are done as per the approved drawings and procedures. To lead review of contractor’s commissioning plan and procedure and provide feedback so that processes and procedure can be revised to align with industry practices. The Commissioning Manager shall ensure all commissioning works done on site are in compliance with HSE requirements of the project. Review of all design and equipment documents to obtain a working knowledge of the system requirements and functionality and carry out review of the commissioning documentation progress.

column2: comment on
column3: and contribute to commissioning test programs
column5:
including the establishment of a reliable and feasible punch list.
  • Provide technical support to the site team during commissioning phase.
  • Carry out review of the commissioning documentation progress.
  • Support to Owner for any technical and organizational aspects related to the systems commissioning.
  • Review
column6:
comment and contribute to the preparation of the Facility O&M Manual(s) and review of all equipment manuals provided for workability and ease of understanding
  • Assess
column7: review and support the contractor to develop the full spare-part list for the facility and the safe and efficient storage of all spare parts. Here’s What You’ll Need

column1:
• Relevant undergraduate degree as a minimum.
  • 15 years' experience as Commissioning Manager/Project Manager/ Construction Manager
  • Advanced understanding of commissioning procedures and processes of a CCGT power plant
  • Demonstrated experience delivering revenues with consistent and profitable growth
  • Experience in reading IFC drawings and P&IDs
column2:
SLD’s and other system configuration diagrams
  • Detailed understanding HSE regulations and construction standards and the value of an early risk identification and preventative action approach
  • Good understanding commercial terms and key business drivers involved on EPC and EPCM projects
  • Ability to review/develop and communicate appropriate project strategies to overcome project/commissioning challenges on site
  • Must have good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Must be able to articulate a clear vision and direction and have good communication skills
  • Proven track record as a leader in relevant businesses
  • Must have broad technical knowledge and hands on approach

column1: Jacobs is looking for a talented BIM Modeler with minimum to join the Malaysian BIM Team. You will be responsible for providing BIM authoring support to technically challenging infrastructures projects. You will be responsible for creating 3D models and prepare 2D drawings and documentation and shall be responsible for the technical quality of your own work and would focus on compliance with project objectives and quality standards. Profound knowledge and experience of BIM is required
column2: as well as an understanding of engineering and architecture. You will be required to work closely with our engineers
column3: modeling and presenting the concepts requested by these team members. The ideal candidate has previous experience in this field as well as good communication ability. You must be able to determine elements and scale
column4: and properly meet deadlines. The candidate must have good attention to detail and be knowledgeable in mathematics and design aspects as well.

column2:
updating and revising BIM Models through out the project life cycle
  • Create and update BIM Models based on contract drawings and latest information
  • Ensure integrity/ quality of the models
  • Generate documentation and shop drawings for BIM Models
  • Produce BIM Model deliverables for Construction
column3:
documentation and fabrication
  • Develop BIM Models with the correct parameters and attributes for BIM Based quantification and 4D simulation
  • Identify issues for BIM Coordinators where discrepancies occur during design stage

column1:
• Appropriate tertiary qualifications combined with practical experience gained on large scale construction projects and proven track record
  • At least 4 Year(s) of relevant experience in C&S
column2:
Reinforcement/ Architectural BIM Models related projects
  • Excellent CAD
column3: Revit (modelling families in Revit and other items)
column4:
and BIM Modelling skills along with strong time management capabilities and the capacity to hit the ground running are additional key attributes that you will bring to this role
  • Experience in bridge and/or underground station project is necessary
  • Knowledge in Bentley Open Bridge Designer
